items.title: With the Governor: Healing and Deliverance
items.big_idea: What changes when you are “with the governor”—with the One who has true authority? Scripture shows God sending His word to heal, fulfilling promises that look impossible, and delivering people from destructive bondage. This study traces that same restoring power from promise to healing to a transformed life.

items.title: Healing and Redemption in Matthew 8
items.big_idea: Matthew 8 presents Jesus acting with authority over sickness and suffering, showing what God’s kingdom looks like in real life. Scripture connects that ministry to God’s identity as Healer, and to what Christ accomplished for us. This study traces healing, redemption from the curse, and the believer’s new identity—so your faith rests on what God has said and done.

items.title: Divine Appointments for Healing and Deliverance
items.big_idea: In Scripture, crisis moments become turning points when God shows up. Whether it is sickness, long waiting, spiritual bondage, fear, or a threatening storm, the Lord is able to intervene by His word. The call is to respond with reverence, faith, and obedience when your moment of encounter arrives.

items.title: God Our Help in Trouble
items.big_idea: Trouble exposes what we truly trust. Scripture invites us to stop searching for “vain” help and to anchor our confidence in the God for whom nothing is too hard. As we obey His word and bring Him what we have, He proves Himself a present help and faithful provider.
tags: Vain Is The Help Of Man
Nothing Is Too Hard For God

items.title: Receiving Healing Through Jesus’ Power
items.big_idea: Scripture presents healing as part of Jesus’ ministry and the outflow of God’s power and compassion. From people who pressed in to touch Jesus, to a crippled man lifted up in His name, the Bible shows faith responding to God’s Word and power. This study traces how healing is revealed, received, and expressed through Jesus—and how believers are called to keep trusting His Word.

items.title: Good News: Jesus Gives Life
items.big_idea: The message is simple and personal: there is good news for someone who needs hope. Jesus does not come to steal life—He comes to give it abundantly. In moments of sickness, loss, and even death, Scripture presents Him as the One who restores what seems impossible.
tags: Jesus The Resurrection And The Life

items.title: Proclaiming Liberty in Deliverance
items.big_idea: Deliverance is more than a moment—it is a proclamation of liberty rooted in God’s provision for atonement. Scripture ties freedom to God’s declared release and God’s decisive follow-through on what He says. This study traces liberty, atonement, and the certainty of God’s word as a biblical framework for deliverance.

items.title: From Lukewarm to Spirit-Powered Witness
items.big_idea: Jesus is the Alpha and Omega, and He is able to restore what has grown cold, weary, or dry. This study traces a clear movement: identify spiritual decline, return to God in repentance, and rise in the Spirit’s power to bring life and healing to others. God revives discouraged hearts and lifeless situations, and He sends revived people to bless their world with the gospel.

items.title: God’s Word Brings Miracles and Healing
items.big_idea: From creation to Jesus’ miracles, Scripture repeatedly shows that God’s word is not mere information—it carries power. When God speaks, impossibilities shift, sickness yields, storms obey, and bondage breaks. This study traces how God sends His word and how people are changed when they trust and act on what He says.

items.title: God’s Name Breaks Bondage
items.big_idea: Bondage is not the final word when God steps into a person’s story. In Scripture, the Lord reveals His name, asserts His authority, and overthrows stubborn oppression. As believers honor His name and respond in faith and obedience, they experience deliverance, growth, and a new way of relating even to enemies.

items.title: Crying Out for God’s Intervention
items.big_idea: When trouble, fear, delay, or loss presses in, Scripture repeatedly shows people calling on God—and God acting. His power cannot be reversed, His promises do not fail, and He strengthens those who reach for Him. From provision in famine to healing in desperation to hope in grief, the Lord responds to faith-filled cries with real intervention.
tags: Praise In The Midst Of Trouble

items.title: Destined by God’s Unchanging Counsel
items.big_idea: Many plans can fill a human heart, but God’s counsel stands forever. Scripture shows destiny is not driven by circumstances but by God’s purpose and His promises. Like Abraham, like David, and like Joseph, faith holds on, waits, and keeps moving in devotion until what God has spoken comes to pass.

items.title: God’s Word in Divine Appointments
items.big_idea: Some time ago, I had an appointment—Scripture shows that God also works through appointed moments. In key Bible stories, God sends His word to bring healing, fulfill what seems impossible, and deliver those trapped in destructive bondage. This study traces how God’s word arrives with authority, and how people respond when restoration comes.

items.title: Joseph: Shielded Through Trials
items.big_idea: Scripture portrays God as a shield who surrounds His people with favor. Joseph’s life shows how identity and calling can attract conflict, yet integrity in temptation and patience in delay keep a person positioned for God’s timing. Along the way, God’s word stands firm, while compromise can derail many—so we learn to stand guarded and obedient.

items.title: Hallelujah: Praise and God’s Sovereignty
items.big_idea: Hallelujah is more than a shout—it is a confession that God is enthroned and unmatched. Scripture presents praise as the fitting response to God’s creative authority, His right to rule, and His worthiness. This study traces why God deserves praise and how a worshiping response aligns our hearts with His sovereignty.

items.title: When God’s Purpose Prevails
items.big_idea: People make many plans, yet Scripture insists that God’s purpose prevails. This study helps you hold your plans with humility, align your decisions with God’s will, and find stability when life does not go according to your expectations. The goal is not to stop planning, but to plan in a way that honors God’s higher purpose.

items.title: Listen Carefully and Trust God’s Word
items.big_idea: Many voices compete for your attention, but Scripture calls you to listen carefully to what God has said. God does not lie, Jesus knows what is in us, and God stays with His people through deep waters and fire. As you fix your mind on Him, receive Christ’s rest, and pair faith with obedient action, you can persevere until God’s appointed vision comes to pass.

items.title: Kingdom Witness Through Acts 8 Persecution
items.big_idea: Scripture presents God as the King whose dominion cannot fail. The book of Acts shows that opposition did not silence the church; it scattered believers and carried the message forward. As the gospel of the kingdom was preached and received, new places were reached—yet disciples were also warned not to replace God’s word with human traditions.

items.title: Healing Power Through Jesus and Faith
items.big_idea: The Bible presents Jesus as the One anointed to heal and deliver, and it also shows that God’s power can be present to heal in real moments of need. From desperate cries to simple acts of reaching out, Scripture highlights faith that connects to Christ’s power. This study traces how God’s Word produces faith, how believers respond, and what healed lives look like afterward.

items.title: Don’t Stop Praying in Hard Times
items.big_idea: When pressure rises, the temptation is to stop praying—but Scripture points the other way. God reigns over kings, circumstances, and every obstacle, and His power is not limited by what we see. This study traces biblical reasons to keep praying with confidence, seeking God as refuge and trusting His authority to answer.

items.title: Marriage: God’s Pattern for Love
items.big_idea: Marriage is not an accident; it is a design. Scripture shows God creating marriage for companionship, calling spouses to a posture of mutual submission, and pointing to love that moves first. When a home follows God’s pattern, it becomes a clear witness through daily conduct, not merely words.

items.title: God’s Help for Problems in Degrees
items.big_idea: Some challenges feel small while others feel overwhelming—but Scripture shows that problems come in degrees, not impossibilities. When help from people fails, God remains the true source of help. He is not limited by the size of the need, and He can provide a way forward that calls for faith-filled obedience.
tags: Nothing Is Too Hard for the Lord

items.title: God’s Name and Jesus’ Exalted Name
items.big_idea: In Exodus, God makes His Name known as a lasting memorial for every generation, and He is celebrated as a mighty warrior. In the New Testament, Jesus is given the Name above every name, and God’s power is seen in extraordinary healings as people come near in faith. The same Scriptures also call believers to respond with a distinct posture—blessing even in the face of persecution.

items.title: Destined: God’s Counsel and Your Walk
items.big_idea: Many plans can be made, but God’s counsel is what stands. Scripture shows people marked by promise who still faced plots, temptation, and imprisonment—yet God’s purpose was not cancelled. This study traces how identity, integrity, and worship keep a believer aligned with God’s destiny.

items.title: Restoration Through Humility
items.big_idea: A new beginning is not the absence of pressure; Jesus said we will face tribulation, yet we can have peace because He has overcome the world. God promises His redeemed people His presence through deep waters and fire, and He is an everlasting refuge. But pride can sabotage a restart—Scripture warns that God resists the proud, humbles the arrogant, and gives grace and restoration to the humble.
